title: Why does my middle finger bend and turn towards the ring finger? Can this be corrected? - Quora

response.answer_text: You may have a trigger finger in which a nerve in your palm is affected. A hand surgeon/orthopedist can treat it easily for most with a cortisone injection. If that doesn’t work for you the next step in minor surgery of your hand. It would be with local anesthesia and you would get light sedation. I had three on my left hand which were fixed and now one on my right which I am waiting on. It is common in diabetics and people with arthritis but also can be caused by trauma like catching a baseball or repetitive strain injury with games and computers.

Almost everything can be changed now days, I;m not a Doctor or a Nurse so you need one of them to tell you for sure. Not to belittle your problems but there are more important things in your life that need your attention. Don’t get hung up on the little things or the big ones get away
